title: Firebase + Kotlin + MVP + Rx: Practical Tips
description: New Firebase products announced at I/O make an Android developer’s life so much easier. We have been happily developing with it since January 2016. Sample projects work great, but what if your database structure is complex and you want a solid architecture with MVP, RxJava and Kotlin? Come to learn some practical tips.

speakers.name: David Vávra
speakers.title: CEO
speakers.shortBio: David is a Google Developer Expert for Android. He is a CEO now, but he still finds time for diving deep into Android architecture.
speakers.bio: David is a Google Developer Expert for Android. He is a CEO now, but he still finds time for diving deep into Android architecture. He currently focuses on Firebase for Android. He loves open-source and gadgets like Android Wear or Android TV. He is the core organiser of GDG Prague events.

title: Wanna more fire? - Let's try polymerfire!
description: Have you ever tried to build Web application using Polymer with Firebase integration, additionally adhere to PWA's canons? I have, and know how many surprises can be found during developmet :). Polymerfire is a great Polymer Web Component Firebase and looks very easy to play with. During my talk I want to dive into tips & tricks on how you can integrate your web app on Polymer with Firebase + how to add offline support (since Firebase uses web sockets for data transferring, service worker will not help in that case).

title: Projektoví Zombíci
description: Projektové řízení je plné přežitých dogmat a nesmyslů, které ovšem stále předáváme dál a ještě hůře, vyžadujeme u certifikací. A přitom většinu teorie můžeme s klidem zahodit a k celé problematice přistupovat jinak. Kostlivce ze skříně ven a projektové zombíky do hrobu.

title: REST API je mrtvé, ať žije GraphQL
description: REST se stal standardem pro API. Poslední dobou se ale ukazuje, že není vhodné pro uživatelské rozhraní. Facebook nám nabídl GraphQL a skvělou knihovnu Relay, která usnadňuje a zrychluje práci s daty v aplikacích.

speakers.shortBio: Co-founded and operated cloud based accounting system ABRA @FlexiBee. Loves backend and so he is involved in @fnxio. Now he's starting a new project.

title: Improve Your Android App's UX With Accessibility
description: Accessibility is a very important step to make sure that your app reaches everyone in an easy and fun way to use. Good accessibility support means much more than just making sure the app supports screen readers, different fonts sizes and good contrast ratios. It is a learning process, and one in which we ourselves still have much to learn and explore.

speakers.bio: Caner is a GDE on UX/UI who is also a technology geek. Mainly focused on the design and marketing of mobile applications. Passionate about good UX, IoT and Android. He works at InnovationBox, a design agency in Istanbul making and creating apps that users love. Caner has been an organiser of GDG Istanbul since 2013, organising, participating, and speaking at events.

title: Make your Polymer web-app Progressive
description: Polymer helps you organize your app and make it more meaningful. In this talk, I will show you how to make your app load faster with app shell, lazy loading etc. and another Tip and Tricks in PWA.

description: Pojďme se společně zamyslet co to znamená pracovat jako znalostní pracovník, jako programátor. Jak z této činnosti vydat maximum. Jak efektivně využít náš hlavní nástroj - mozek. Přiblížíme si pojmy jako je hluboká práce, inovace, zen programmer a nastavení mysli.

Pracovní zkušenosti získal ve firmách Česká Spořitelna, Hewlett Packard, Vendavo, Nokia, Tieto. Jeden z organizátorů konference o budoucnosti práce Wisephora. Primárně programuje v Javě, ale rád zkouší i jiné jazyky. Pravidelný účastník Coderetreatů, celodenních cvičení pro zdokonalování programátorských technik. Zastánce čistého kódu, TDD, BDD. Spoluautor knihy Vaadin 7 Cookbook. IT Geek a Kouzelník.

title: Iterative Product Development
description: We have an idea for a great product! Or do we? In this session we will explore cases where iterations can help define and grow the best product.

speakers.name: Silvana Wasitova
speakers.shortBio: Silvana Wasitova CSP and PMP, started her Scrum journey as part of the Agile transformation at Yahoo!, and used Scrum to successfully deliver FIFA Worldcup 2006 and Olympics 2008 portals.
speakers.bio: Silvana Wasitova CSP and PMP, started her Scrum journey as part of the Agile transformation at Yahoo!, and used Scrum to successfully deliver FIFA Worldcup 2006 and Olympics 2008 portals. Silvana has coached multinational enterprises in their Agile transformation journeys in United States and across Europe. Silvana lives and breathes the agile value of “People over Process”, and brings that to the forefront in her coaching approaches, while still focused on the client’s audacious goals and desired results. Her experiences include implementing and coaching scrum transformation in Yahoo, Nestle, Roche, Skype, Microsoft, Aviva and a private Swiss bank.

title: Building data-driven IoT mobile applications
description: I will be talk about how to use data from various IoT devices, sensors, open datasets for building mobile apps. How to store data in real time database in Firebase and how to design interfaces that will interact with these devices.

speakers.name: Světlana Margetová
speakers.shortBio: iOS developer with orientation on the best UI/UX during developing and preparing mobile app.
speakers.bio: iOS developer with orientation on the best UI/UX during developing and preparing mobile app. I am data analyst now, but I can effectively connect data information with mobile use cases with focus on IoT systems, sensors and other smaller devices. Skills: Swift, Firebase, UI/UX

title: Building Node.js apps on Google Cloud Platform
description: Node.js makes building web applications that perform at scale easy - Google App Engine makes running Node.js in production fun. In this session, we're going to learn about the various ways to run Node.js applications on Google Cloud. We'll walk through deploying your first Hello World app and using the gcloud NPM module, we will connect our app to other Google Cloud services such as Vision API (to classify images), Cloud Storage (for binary storage), Pub/Sub (for messaging). We will look at versioning, traffic splitting, live debugging, HTTP tracing and all other features that make running Node.js in the cloud fun!

speakers.name: Mete Atamel
speakers.title: Developer Advocate
speakers.shortBio: I'm a Developer Advocate at Google, currently focused on helping developers with Google Cloud Platform.
speakers.bio: I'm a Developer Advocate at Google, currently focused on helping developers with Google Cloud Platform. As a long-time Java and a recent C# developer, I like to compare the two ecosystems. Prior to Google, I worked at Microsoft, Skype, Adobe, EMC, and Nokia building apps and services on various web, mobile and cloud platforms. Originally from Cyprus, I currently live in Greenwich, not too far away from the prime meridian.

title: Guide to the jungle of testing frameworks
description: There are many tools, libraries and frameworks available for Android developers to test their applications. The jungle is huge and it's not easy to find the right ones. Some frameworks are good for unit testing, some are good for instrumentation testing, and some can be used for both. Some have great capabilities but annoying weaknesses. Some are good for testing UI, other allow you to make good mocks. We will look at many frameworks, the popular ones like Mockito, Robolectric, Espresso, and some other.

speakers.name: Tomáš Kypta
speakers.shortBio: Tomas is an Android developer and architect at Avast. He’s focusing on designing the architecture of Android applications
speakers.bio: Tomas is an Android developer and architect at Avast. He’s focusing on designing the architecture of Android applications, libraries and SDKs as well as pushing good coding and testing practices.

title: Správa závislostí Android projektu
description: Přidat novou knihovnu k projektu je velmi snadné. Málokdo ale již zkoumá, co taková závislost přináší a co může bez vašeho vědomí změnit. Na problematiku se podíváme zejména z pohledu systému Gradle a Android manifestu. Téma obsahuje i část, jak přidávat vlastní závislosti, a je určeno spíše středně pokročilým vývojářům.

Then we will go trough the the process of picking the best framework and model. And finally you will see how to test your model and use it in your project.

speakers.bio: V AIMTECu pracuji od roku 2006 jako součást padesátihlavého týmu, který zajišťuje dodávku našeho vlastního produktu DCIx. Jsem rád za přátelské vztahy, prostředí, férovou komunikaci, a vůbec za celou atmosféru, která u nás panuje. Taky mě těší, když vidím, jak se ze studentů u nás stávají profesionální programátoři, které nám závidí zákazníci i konkurence.
